item.title: Emoticons in commit messages for manuscripts
item.description: I recently wrote a note about using emoticons in a standard way in commit messages and I now use them in a standard way following Gitmoji. I do so for my code, but I also use git for manuscrits and I also try to standardize the way I use emoticons in that case. Below is the set of emoticons I am currently using for manuscrits: ğŸ“ pencil add a significant piece of writing, paragraph; âœï¸ pencil2typos; ğŸ“Š bar_chart figures added or edited (figure or its caption); ğŸ—‘ wastebasket delete an file; âœ¨ sparkles integrate co-author’s comment(s)/work; ğŸ‰ tada address reviewer’s comment(s); â¬†ï¸ arrow_up version submitted; ğŸš€ rocket version accepted.
